Package hw3.squarelotron

Class Squarelotron

java.lang.Object
hw3.squarelotron.Squarelotron
All Implemented Interfaces:
SquarelotronMethods
Direct Known Subclasses:
LargeSquarelotron, SmallSquarelotron
public abstract class Squarelotron extends Object implements SquarelotronMethods
This class represents a squarelotron, a square matrix with certain rotation and flipping operations. The class contains common variables and methods shared between SmallSquarelotron and LargeSquarelotron.
Since:
31/04/24
Version:
1.2
Author:
Panagiotis Tsembekis

  • Method Details

    • getSquarelotron

      public int[][] getSquarelotron()
      Returns a direct reference to the squarelotron's matrix.
      Returns:
      The 2D array representing the square matrix of the squarelotron.

    • makeSquarelotron

      public static Squarelotron makeSquarelotron(int[] array) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a Squarelotron object from an array of integers.
      Parameters:
      array - An array of integers representing the elements of the squarelotron.
      Returns:
      A Squarelotron object.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length of the array is not 16 or 25, or if any element of the array is not within the range (0, 99].

      Returns the numbers of the squarelotron in a 1D array.

      Returns:

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Determines if this squarelotron is equal to another object. Equality is defined based on the structure and content of the squarelotron. A squarelotron is considered equal to another squarelotron if they have the same size and all corresponding elements are equal. Additionally, this implementation considers a squarelotron equal to any of its rotated versions (90Â°, 180Â°, 270Â° clockwise).
      Specified by:
      equals in interface SquarelotronMethods
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - The object to be compared with this squarelotron for equality.
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this squarelotron or any of its rotated versions; false otherwise.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the squarelotron. The returned string consists of each row of the squarelotron's matrix on a new line, with each element formatted to a fixed width for alignment. This provides a clear and aligned representation of the squarelotron's current state when printed.
      Specified by:
      toString in interface SquarelotronMethods
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the squarelotron's matrix.
